question.question_text: Which command will stop an infinite loop?
_______ is the process of finding errors and fixing them within a program.
Which of the sets of statements below will add 1 to x if x is positive and subtract 1 from x if x is negative but leave x alone if x is 0?
What best describes the purpose of a classâ€™s constructor?
question.answer: Initialize the fields in the object.
Determines the amount of space needed for an object and creates the object.
Initialize the methods of the class/object.

question.question_text: Under which of these conditions is it appropriate to overload a method (ie: the class will contain two methods with the same name)?
question.answer: The methods have different parameter names.
Two methods with the same name can never be included in the same class.
The methods have different numbers of parameters.

question.question_text: Which of the following is true about abstract classes?
question.answer: Abstract classes cannot be instantiated, but they can be sub-classed.
Abstract classes can be instantiated, but they cannot be sub-classed.
Abstract classes can only contain abstract methods. They can be sub-classed.
Abstract classes can only contain abstract methods. They cannot be sub-classed.
Abstract classes can be instantiated, and can be sub-classed.

question.question_text: Which of these keywords are used for the block to be examined for exceptions?
Which of these is used to access a member of class before object of that class is created?
Which of the following declarations will cause a compile time error?
What is returned from arr[3] if arr={6, 3, 1, 2, 9}?
